content.description:
A great boulder problem just right of Blue Lambo. Start sitting on the long crimp next to the arete. Reach right to a small intermediate crimp, then right again to a slightly better crimp. Slap up to the sloper and continue up and slightly left with big moves between good holds to a sloping topout.

The landing is pretty bad as of this writing, so a good spotter is key. If you fall from midway up or higher you could miss the first tier of the landing zone and fall down further into some talus taking your spotter with you. But dont let that scare you off of this super fun boulder problem. Just put your spotter in the right place.
content.protection: several pads and an attentive spotter
content.location: Just right of Blue Lambo on the pretty face.

content.description:
Sit start on a sloping slot. Slap up through worsening slopers with a big drive-by move and mantle onto an easierÂ upper section.

Fantastic movement on unbelievably grippy, bomber rock. Unfortunately marred by the dust and sand that coats the rock from the hillside above. Bring a brush. All of the critical holds are brushable from stacked pads.
content.location: From the Road damage parking, hike down canyon two washes. Follow the second wash uphill for about 10 minutes to a short sandy cliffband. Rhinoplasty climbs the the obvious nose feature on the left side of the cliff.

content.description: Start sitting low on the arete. Make a hard move out left to a good left facing sidepull under the roof then continue up the arete using good holds to a somewhat awkward lip encounter onto a sloping shelf.
content.protection: a couple pads and a spotter.
content.location: If looking at the boulder from the river, it is on the left arete on the downhill side of the boulder.

content.description: A short, but fun boulder problem to the left of Blue Lambo. Start matched on a right facing sloper sidepull. Make a couple of moves on bad slopers to the good rail above and topout on jugs.
